issue.subject: option delete user easysdi and/ user joomla
issue.description: ad the option to be able to delete a user joomla and / or easysdi when deleting a user in the backend & frontend

custom_fields.name: Functional impact
custom_fields.value:
No more trash.
User can't be delete if other objects are linked to it.

custom_fields.value: New dialog windows to allowe user to validate actions

journals.notes:
I would suggest that it should be a general parameter for easySDI under component "CONTACT" with a toggle like this :

Delete the Joomla user when the EasySDI account is deleted :  yes/no


-----

open questions : 

- interaction with "EasySDI plugin Contact" ?
- is it a delete feature or a "trash" feature ? / if the user is in the trash, what is the behaviour or the user account (inactive automatically ?)
Any input on this question Thomas ?

My opinion is that the trash feature for EasySDI contact is unnecessary. A warning message would be sufficient.

I don't think an option to delete also JOOMLA user is a good idea. EasySDI should not be able to delete JOOMLA user.

As we can't add an easySDI user without creating a JOOMLA user, we should not be able to delete a JOOMLA user throw EasySDI.

If I can give my word here: -At ASIT VD we manage ~1600 joomla user accounts, all of them are EasySDI accounts. -We have about 20 new account per week -Some of them are spam, non-interested users, errors etc... we have to drop them (that's the need) -We won't delete "real" account that have history, if an account is no more needed we would prefer to disable it Proposal: For my use, the best would be a modal on user deletion, something like this: 
+---------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                       X |
+---------------------------------------------------------+
|   You are about to delete an EasySDI User,              |
|   what do you want to do with the joomla User?          |
|                                                         |
|                                                         |
|   +--------+   +---------+   +----------------------+   |
|   | Delete |   | Disable |   | Do nothing (keep it) |   |
|   +--------+   +---------+   +----------------------+   |
|                                            +--------+   |
|                                            | Cancel |   |
|                                            +--------+   |
+---------------------------------------------------------+

Remark: I see that we can "trash" an EasySDI user, it functional (Yes it goes in the trash, but is the logic followed... does it forbids the user to have right, create ressources etc...) ? If not, I would propose to hide this feature
For info, this feature was already in discussion on previsous easySDI version here :#544

I have tested the trash logic. When an EasySDI user is trashed, he can connect and create ressources. I'm ok to disable the trash function and propose to delete directly the user. But we have to verify before deleting if there are objects linked to the EasySDI User. If it is the case, admin should not be able to delete it and a message should explain why : 
- Ressources are linked to the user
- Command are linked to the user
- etc...

Ok for your Dialog proposition Yves.

Open questions:
- tests before deleting a user (existing orders...)
- do we propose a logic for organisms ?
TC has vaildated the Yves' proposal and Thomas' addition.
